title: How to Make Under the Sea Themed Cupcakes

methods.name: Assess Your Time and Skill Level

steps.headline: Determine if you want to create a cupcake with real a “wow” factor or if you are looking for something cute that will match your party theme.
Evaluate your baking skill level.
steps.description: Essentially, creating these cute cupcakes comes down to what you are comfortable doing. Are you interested in creating a crab completely from frosting or would you prefer building a small sea creature using gumdrops?

steps.headline: Figure out how many cupcakes you will need to build.
steps.description: Taking time and skill into consideration, how long will it take you to create the desired number of cupcakes with your chosen method? While you may want to try your hand at a detailed frosting crab; do you have time and energy to create 40?

steps.headline: Consider if you can reduce time by cutting a few corners.
steps.description: Using a cake mix from a box or even ordering plain cupcakes from the local bakery (that you can decorate at home) will save a few steps if you are pressed for time.

steps.headline: Determine if you will have assistance.
steps.description: Will you have another adult pitching in to decorate the cupcakes or does your child want to help? If your child wants to help (and you are willing to work together), you may want to go with an easier design that he/she can assemble with ease.

steps.headline: Go for a quick but cute design.
Create an “under the sea” cupcake your child could create.
Prepare a frosting crab.

text:
Assess Your Time and Skill Level Determine if you want to create a cupcake with real a “wow” factor or if you are looking for something cute that will match your party theme. Evaluate your baking skill level. Essentially, creating these cute cupcakes comes down to what you are comfortable doing. Are you interested in creating a crab completely from frosting or would you prefer building a small sea creature using gumdrops? Figure out how many cupcakes you will need to build. Taking time and skill into consideration, how long will it take you to create the desired number of cupcakes with your chosen method? While you may want to try your hand at a detailed frosting crab; do you have time and energy to create 40? Consider if you can reduce time by cutting a few corners. Using a cake mix from a box or even ordering plain cupcakes from the local bakery (that you can decorate at home) will save a few steps if you are pressed for time. Determine if you will have assistance. Will you have another adult pitching in to decorate the cupcakes or does your child want to help? If your child wants to help (and you are willing to work together), you may want to go with an easier design that he/she can assemble with ease. Choose Your Design Go for a quick but cute design. If you are really pressed for time and resources, you can still create a delicious beach-themed cupcake without a lot of skill and effort. Crush 20 graham cracker cookies in a large plastic bag. The crushed graham crackers will become a “sandy beach” atop your cupcake so take time to thoroughly crush the cookies. Transfer crushed cookies to a paper plate. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Frost a thin layer on top of each cupcake. Choose light blue frosting (tint white frosting with blue food coloring), which will represent water when you are finished. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Dip half of the cupcake in the crushed cookies. Now you have a sandy beach! {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add more blue frosting to the other half of the cupcake and gently lift the frosting to create small peaks. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Top with a small drink umbrella, perched atop of the sandy beach side of the cupcake. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet5.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet5.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-6Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":274,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":452.032967032967,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Create an “under the sea” cupcake your child could create. Using candy, create a small sea turtle to sit on top of each cupcake. You will need sour peach gummy ring candies, gum drops (red and green), spearmint leaf candies and mini chocolate chips. Add a thin layer of frosting to each cupcake. However, don’t frost each cupcake too early in advance as you don’t want the frosting to dry. The frosting will act as the “glue” to hold your sea turtle in place. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place the peach gummy ring in the middle of the cupcake and add a gumdrop to its middle. This will be the basis for the turtle’s shell. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add a gumdrop to the top of the gummy ring to become the turtle’s head. Consider using a green gumdrop for the head, especially to match the spearmint leaf candy arms. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Slice a spearmint candy in half to create the turtle’s fins. For faster assembly, do this ahead of time. Create more of a fin appearance by rounding out the inside of the spearmint candy so that it fits around the outside of the peach ring candy. Don’t discard the cut pieces--the smaller cut pieces can be used for the turtle’s feet. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a1/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a1/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":260,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":429.0659340659341,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place the larger pieces of spearmint candy alongside the top of the peach gummy candy and below the turtle’s head. Add the feet at the bottom. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet5.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet5.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place a dab of frosting on the bottom of two mini chocolate chips and place on each side of the turtle’s head to create the eyes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet6.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet6.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet6.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-7Bullet6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Prepare a frosting crab. This cupcake design may be slightly more time consuming and require a higher skill level, but can be mastered with just a small amount of practice. Gather your supplies. You will need two frosting bag tips (#104 and #3), a bag of red frosting (white icing mixed with red food coloring), small white jawbreaker candies (or another round white candy) and a black food coloring pen. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add a thin layer of frosting to each cupcake. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Create the crab’s base by making a small, thick half moon atop a pre-frosted cupcake (using tip #104). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add the two white eyes (or jawbreaker/white candies) to the middle/back of your base and create eyeballs using the black food coloring pen. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":251,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":415.4945054945055,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Pipe a small amount of red frosting behind the eyes using the #3 tip. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet5.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet5.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":253,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":417.5824175824176,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Pipe over the top of the eyes using tip #104. Completely blanket and cover the crab from bottom of the base, over the top of the eyes to the other side of the base-- this is the upper half of the crab shell. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet6.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet6.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet6.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Create legs and crab claws using the #3 tip. Give the crab three legs on each side of the base and then two pincher claws in front. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet7.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet7.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet7.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Under-the-Sea-Themed-Cupcakes-Step-8Bullet7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Finished.
